result.execSummary:
The defendant Luke A Weaver was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $343 to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  $200 DNA surcharge remitted.

Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights.

Defendant in court with Attorney Catherine Dorl.  Rachel E Sattler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Luke A Weaver in court with attorney Catherine Dorl. Prosecuting Atty Rachel E Sattler appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed.  Def entered a plea of no contest to counts 1 & 3  Court accepted def's plea, found and adjudged defn guilty. Bail continued. Parties agree on probation at sentencing but are free to argue conditions of probation.
Sentencing hearing on August 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on June 13, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant in court with Attorney Catherine Dorl.  Rachel E Sattler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Luke A Weaver in court with attorney Catherine Dorl. ADA Sattler objects to set over of trial. Ct finds good cause for continuance.  Ct. grants motion for continuance. Bail conditions continued.

Trial Judge - Br 5

Defendant appeared.  Chelsea E Wetjen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 10:15 am.
